0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• belladonna and opium rectal suppositories have not been found by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to be safe and effective; product labeling has not been approved by the FDA
  • Ureteric pain (Moderate to Severe), associated with ureteral spasm not responsive to non-narcotic analgesics and to space intervals between injectable opiates: 1 suppository (each suppository: belladonna 16.2 mg/opium 30 mg OR belladonna 16.2 mg/opium 60 mg) RECTALLY once or twice a day, MAX 4 doses/day

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• belladonna and opium rectal suppositories have not been found by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to be safe and effective; product labeling has not been approved by the FDA
  • not recommended for use in children 12 years of age or younger
  • Ureteric pain (Moderate to Severe), associated with ureteral spasm not responsive to non-narcotic analgesics and to space intervals between injectable opiates: over 12 years of age, 1 suppository (each suppository: belladonna 16.2 mg/opium 30 mg OR belladonna 16.2 mg/opium 60 mg) RECTALLY once or twice a day, MAX 4 doses/day

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
Ureteric pain (Moderate to Severe), associated with ureteral spasm not responsive to non-narcotic analgesics and to space intervals between injectable opiates

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• alcoholism, acute
  • asthma, bronchial
  • convulsive disorders
  • delirium tremens
  • glaucoma
  • hepatic disease, severe
  • labor, premature
  • narcotic idiosyncrasies
  • renal disease, severe
  • respiratory depression

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• addiction may occur
  • cardiac disease
  • elderly or debilitated
  • glaucoma, incipient
  • idiosyncrasy to atropine or to atropine-like compounds, known
  • intracranial pressure, increased
  • morphine or morphine-like drug sensitivity or addiction, known
  • myxedema
  • prostatic hypertrophy
  • toxic psychosis

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Belladonna/opium rectal suppository is a combination narcotic analgesic/antispasmodic agent. The belladonna extract provides the active alkaloids atropine and scopolamine, while the opium component provides, primarily, morphine. The atropine alkaloid is parasympatholytic, exerting antispasmodic activity by relaxation of smooth muscle. Atropine activity also counteracts morphine induced smooth muscle spasm without affecting the analgesia. The morphine alkaloid of opium exerts analgesic activity by increasing the pain threshold and decreasing the sensitivity to pain. The oxidative dealkylated nor-metabolites of morphine begin the analgesic process.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Rectal
moisten finger and suppository with water prior to insertion

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: relief of moderate to severe pain associated with ureteral spasm and increase in intervals between opiate injections are indicative of efficacy

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:

Rectal Suppository: (Belladonna Alkaloids - Opium Alkaloids) 16.2 MG-30 MG, 16.2 MG-60 MG

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono: Drug may cause drowsiness, dizziness, dry mouth, constipation, nausea, vomiting, urinary retention, photophobia, blurred vision, rapid pulse, pruritus, and urticaria.
